TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: uzai a mareḍava katua mareqali ka sitsuayan a masiasik.
ozai a maredrava katoa mareqali ka sicoayan a masiasik.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there were some girls and men weeding.

S.FORM: masasuvalivalit tiamadju a masik.
masasovalivalit tiamadjo a masik.
S.TRANSL: They took it in turns to weed.

S.FORM: kiłavaran a mareqali: "timunay anan a mareḍava a masik," ayain.
kiljavaran a mareqali: "timonay anan a maredrava a masik," ayain.
S.TRANSL: The men said: “You girls weed first.”

S.FORM: "ui," aya azua mareḍava.
"oi," aya azoa maredrava.
S.TRANSL: “All right,” said the girls.

S.FORM: qau masik azua mareḍava.
qao masik azoa maredrava.
S.TRANSL: The girls weeded,

S.FORM: qau azua mareqali qemiladj itjua qapaz nua kavuavuan.
qao azoa mareqali qemiladj itjoa qapaz noa kavoavoan.
S.TRANSL: and the men sat at the edge of the field

S.FORM: qau sa san paḍangani a mareḍava.
qao sa san padrangani a maredrava.
S.TRANSL: and teased the girls.

S.FORM: nu masik azua mareḍava, kidjeketsan a tsengal nua qalitsi.
no masik azoa maredrava, kidjekecan a cengal noa qalici.
S.TRANSL: While the girls weeded, the men touched their (the women’s) knees with their private parts.

S.FORM: qau "ii ii," aya a mareḍava, sa sapsapi azua qalitsi.
qao "ii ii," aya a maredrava, sa sapsapi azoa qalici.
S.TRANSL: “Oo oo,” said the girls, and scratched at the men’s private parts.

S.FORM: łakua inika masapsap; tsemiketsikel azua qalitsi a sema tjua tsengal.
ljakoa inika masapsap; cemikecikel azoa qalici a sema tjoa cengal.
S.TRANSL: But they didn’t get rid of them; they kept coming back to their knees.

S.FORM: qau temarev anga aza mareḍava.
qao temarev anga aza maredrava.
S.TRANSL: And so the girls finished their turn of weeding.

S.FORM: qau "timunay anga a masik," ayain azua mareqali.
qao "timonay anga a masik," ayain azoa mareqali.
S.TRANSL: “Now it’s you to weed,” the men were told.

S.FORM: qau vaik azua mareqali a masik.
qao vaik azoa mareqali a masik.
S.TRANSL: So the men went to weed.

S.FORM: nu masik azua mareqali, kidjeketsan nua kutji a tsengal.
no masik azoa mareqali, kidjekecan noa kotji a cengal.
S.TRANSL: While the men were weeding, their knees were touched by the girls’ private parts.

S.FORM: "ii, a kutji," aya mareqali, sa sapsapi.
"ii, a kotji," aya mareqali, sa sapsapi.
S.TRANSL: “Ugh, private parts,” said the men, and brushed them away;

S.FORM: łakua inika sualap.
ljakoa inika soalap.
S.TRANSL: but they didn’t go away.

S.FORM: qau luslusen tua vuka.
qao loslosen toa voka.
S.TRANSL: They prodded them with digging-sticks,

S.FORM: łakua inika sualap angata.
ljakoa inika soalap angata.
S.TRANSL: but they just wouldn’t go away.

S.FORM: qau marekutj azua mareqali tua kutji.
qao marekotj azoa mareqali toa kotji.
S.TRANSL: The men were afraid of these private parts.

S.FORM: qau pagerits azua mareqali, sa kavilad anga.
qao pageric azoa mareqali, sa kavilad anga.
S.TRANSL: And the men screamed and ran away.
